EmailTemplate.name: C&PS_Portal-SRD-Comms-Subscription_Email_Operational.SRD Subscription April 2021
EmailTemplate.subject: Product reliability presentations are updated
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
We would like you to be aware we updated our Product Reliability presentations on the aerospace portal. You can access them here <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/en/secure/downloads/service-request-updates]]>.
During the month of April we closed out the following Reliability Improvement Programs. These presentations will be available for the next 60 days. Document Title
Corrective Action/ Documentation
ATA Chapter
OEM
Platform
Part Numbers(s)
APU HGT1700[A] Oil Sensor
Released SB D202002000459, “Airborne Auxiliary Power – Gas Turbine Engine – Replace Oil Level Sensor (OLS) PN 70720171-1 with PN 70720171-2 on the HGT1700[A] Auxiliary Power Unit (APU), on February 17, 2021
ATA 49
Airbus
A350
70720171-1
IMMR Sustained GPS Outage
Updated STCs and released SBs for affected A/C models. Please reference the reliability presentation for details regarding specific service bulletins.
ATA 34
Airbus, Boeing
A320, A330, 757, 767, 777 737NG, 737 MAX
69002600-0101
69002602-0101
69002602-0201
AS907 AFT Sump / No. 4 Carbon Seal Investigation
Released SB AS907-72-9094, Install improved No. 4 Bearing Carbon Seal PN 70041289-2 on AS907 Model Engines, on February 1, 2021.
ATA 72
Bombardier, Gulfstream, Embraer, Cessna
CL 300/350, G280, PREATOR, LONGITUDE, LEGACY 450/500
3035532-3 During the month of April we opened the following Reliability Improvement programs for root cause investigation. Document Title
Record Locator
ATA Chapter
OEM
Platform
Part Numbers(s)
AS 907 Compressor Abradable Metco 312 Spalling <[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/content/dam/aero/en-us/documents/document-lists/service-request-updates/cwa_users/SR-156240-AS907-Compressor-Abradable-METCO-312-Spalling.pdf]]>
SR-156240
ATA 72
Bombardier, Gulfstream
CL 350, G280
3033185-4, 3033186-5, 3033187-4
For further information on these reliability improvement programs, please click on the document title.
Sincerely,
Honeywell Global Technical Operations Team
